Reviews.Title: “A Nice One - Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Khurshid A
Reviews.Content: I stayed alone before but this time I stayed with my family as my daughter stays nearby. It was really good and very convenient for me and my family. Staff was very helpful beside the management was very supportive and caring.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RoadrunnerSwansea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we were up for a concert. Very convenient location from the M4 with large free car park. Staff very helpful, very clean room with comfortable beds. 10 minute walk to the tube. Enjoyed well cooked breakfast but not fine dining. We thought it was really good value for money. We have stayed in worse and paid a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value! Great service! Great prices!”
Reviews.Author: ashley130784
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times now when i'm in town. The location is great being a 5 minute walk to boston manor tube station. They have a big car park too which is a great bonus for a London hotel. The onsite restaurant serves great food and overall the price is very reasonable when booking direct. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Andy45645645
Reviews.Content: I recently stopped here for one night as I had an interview in nearby Brentford the following day. I had booked a single room for just £40, but was happy to find I had been given a double room. The room itself was clean and although not the largest room I've stopped in, was a perfectly adequate size. As some other reviewers have found the room was slightly dated, perhaps in need of the paintwork touching up, but was was very clean and had a TV, tea and coffee facilities, etc. The bathroom was modern and also very clean. My only slight gripe with the accommodation is that the bottom bed sheet was slightly stained, with faint red marks. If it wasn't for this I would have given 5/5. The English breakfast was fine with egg, bacon, sausage, beans, toast and tea/coffee and cereal/juice also available to help yourself. The hotel is about 15 mins walk from Boston Manor tube station on the Piccadilly line with easy access to central London. Overall very good value for money and would not hesitate to stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Adam P
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a triple room for one night. The hotel in general was slightly rough around the edges but offered good value for money. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's utterly disgusting - BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tictaktoe
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't rabid dogs stay here. It is atrocious! The price isn't low enough for this hell hole. I too was a victim of BED BUGS!!! The room was filthy, my partner and I didn't want to use the mouldy shower. The toilet was filthy. There were mouse traps in the room. The quilt was black and looked about 20 years old. Utter HELL

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere Different”
Reviews.Author: ColorTec
Reviews.Content: This quirky and characterful establishment offers good-value basic accommodation. A clean, comfortable bed and a decent breakfast make up for any minor shortcomings in the room facilities (you might want to bring your own basin plug) and this is fine for overnight business trips. Easy access makes it a good base from which to reach west London and flexible check-in/check-out times are available if you ask nicely!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sophie t
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and immaculate. It is very well maintained and spotless. We were treated exceptionally well by all staff. We enjoyed every minute of our stay and we will be back again soon. Brilliant!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Ealing hospital”
Reviews.Author: Debbie A
Reviews.Content: Stayed for seven days at Boston Manor Hotel for a course at Ealing hospital. Staff were friendly. Had asked for a study table and was pleasantly surprised that I was given a large double room. Very clean and tidy, food was excellent in the restaurant. Good value for money. Would recommend to anyone looking to visit Ealing.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently while visiting friends in Ealing. We stayed in a double room and could not fault the hotel for its fantastic location (being close to Ealing town centre), friendly and attentive staff, cleanliness and value for money. I would definitely stay here again and also recommend the hotel for its access to London, Heathrow and other major travel links such as the M25 and M4.

Reviews.Title: “Fair to middling”
Reviews.Author: Trevor M
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 x 4 nights. First week in a double room (room 216) with a very comfortable double bed but the shower room had a distasteful and lingering odour. The second week I was in room 205 with a less comfortable single bed and a shower room that, whilst odour free, had exposed electrical wiring above the shower. Not ideal. Liked : price, location (I drive to London from the west), and friendly staff. The rooms I stayed in were quiet in terms of traffic noise. Disliked : scruffy decor, always some repair work seems to be taking place on the premises. No desk or surface in the room useful enough to work on.

Reviews.Title: “Beware.”
Reviews.Author: MrsG28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as it was conveniently located close to Ealing hospital. On arrival, after paying for the room for 2 nights, we were told we would have to move hotels on the second night! Somewhere we'd never heard of! After a bit of an arguement, we were permitted to stay! But not ideal when travelling with a 4 year old, and you arrive quite late at night. The room itself wasn't up to much. The breakfasts were reasonable. I would not recommend it overall.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going for the Ealing paces course - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Cr1183
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this place is that it's close to Ealing hospital. Otherwise it's just grim. No hot water. Horrible rooms. There are prisons that are nicer. If you're doing the Ealing course take your money elsewhere (even if it means a slightly longer walk to the course).

Reviews.Title: “a perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: I was visiting my daughter in London. As she couldn't host me at her place I needed to find something nice with affordable prices and good location. I decided to try Boston Manor Hotel and was extremely happy with my choice. First of the hotel itself is very lovely and cosy. I felt like I was at home, my room was very nicely done, it was spacious, cosy and neat. The hotel stuff was very attentive and caring, I felt very secure and comfortable. Secondly the hotel has an absolutely perfect location. I was travelling from Heathrow. It took only 15-20 min to get it by tube and approximately 15-20 min to get central London. When I was flying back to home, I had a very early flight, the taxi cost me just 14 pounds which is nothing for London prices! Besides, the location was especially good for me because my daughter lives in that area, and it was so easy for me and for her to visit and see each other that made me absolutely happy! And finally, the prices were very affordable, it was a very good value for money, my stay in Boston Manor significantly saved my finances. I would like to thank everyone from the hotel for the care, attention and great services. I had a truly wonderful time there and I will be very happy to come back! Thank you very much! You made me very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: Aishah P
Reviews.Content: It's about seven miles west of central london and close to the London Metro about half way between Heathrow airport and Piccadilly Circus. Excellent value with very nice friendly staff. The room was good and the bed very comfortable. Its a great base for touring London for a few days. It's easy to book at short notice and great value for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “cosy & comfortable, felt like home”
Reviews.Author: princess_anu
Reviews.Content: Well, it gave me one of my favourite trip! The rooms were comfortable and cosy. The bell staff and the front desk staff were great...very helpful! Very well located near the tube station! Our experience here was perfect in every way. We were welcomed, charmed and left wanting to come back again and again. Thanks guys!! keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful!!”
Reviews.Author: darren r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night as a base for the rugby league final at Wembley. We arrived and checked in at 1pm and were allocated rooms. All was well until we returned at 10pm that night to open our room and find our personal possessions had been removed without our permission! Someone else was now in the room! After asking what the hell was going on we were taken to another room where we found our possessions in a plastic bin bag on the bed. Understandably we were furious but the idiot on the reception could shed no light on what had happened. We did take it up with the equally useless receptionist the following morning but he just said the manager wasn't in until Monday! Needless to say i will be taking the matter further. Please do not stop at this hotel, it is a disgrace, dated and the customer service..well, it's non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome everytime, nice people to stay with.”
Reviews.Author: Asif A
Reviews.Content: I travel around the country for my business and value a good night's rest. I've stayed at the Boston Manor Hotel 6/7 times in the last few months and had a pleasant restful stay everytime . The staff are always helpful, the rooms clean, tidy and comfortable....book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Mo L
Reviews.Content: Travelling on a budget, I booked this hotel which is close to the London Tube on which it takes only 30 minutes to reach the centre of London for a show or shopping. Bed was very comfortable and room clean with an ensuite toilet and shower. With free parking and an excellent indian restaurant, it was a pleasant and comfortable stay....the price was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints - Excellent Service...”
Reviews.Author: FASpencer
Reviews.Content: No complaints here at all, in fact the service was excellent overall, not really sure what the others are complaining about - sounds malicious to me...

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: MrsG186258
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel it as it was cheap, had a free car park, and wasn't far from a tube station that connected into central London. Big mistake! The hotel overall is very dated, shabby, and smells strongly of curry as a result of the in-house curry restaurant. That wouldn't be so bad, but our room was disgusting - three floors up a steep, narrow staircase, poorly furnished with peeling paint and shabby woodwork, dated furniture, rock-hard beds - literally, imagine sleeping on a block of concrete - and very dirty. There were stains all over the walls and carpet, and odd stains on the ceiling too - coffee? wine? blood? Who knows. The bathroom had no ventilation barring an overhead fan which was so clogged with dirt and dust that it revved like a lawnmower, and it STANK - some kind of blocked sewage pipe maybe, a truly vile stench. The room was hot and stuffy so we had to sleep with the windows open, listening to traffic roaring past all night. At such low prices we didn't expect luxury, but surely it's not too much to expect a hotel to be clean and comfortable. This place makes the average Travelodge look like the Ritz -spend an extra few pounds and book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Really good; really.”
Reviews.Author: RichardEdwin
Reviews.Content: Staff are nice, efficient, accessible; the room is clean, functional; the matress firm: aâhh! Wonderful. Open air car park is under video surveillance. Price is most reasonable for London: one pays for the room, as in Europe, not per capita as is rife in the UK; full English breakfast is included in the price,; the coffee's good. Get an Oyster card: E8 bus from hotel is three stops from Boston Manor underground station on the Picadilly Line; thus Central London is at most one hour away. Internet access must be paid for, but works well. Finally, the Nepalese cooking at the hotel restaurant is a delight: de-li-cious. Enjoy your stay. Richard P.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Misswhitmoore
Reviews.Content: our room was very basic and was right next to a busy road so quite noisy. the cleanliness of the rooms could have neen improved. More like a hostal than a hotel. Nice breakfast though allthough wasnt enough seats for everyone to eat at the same time. Polite staff. Looks like its being refurbed an when it is think it will be much nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!! Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: TT04
Reviews.Content: Hotel seemed cleaned upon entering. However, I woke to find 3 bugs in my bed - i am covered in bites. Only stayed one night. Mentioned to the manager upon checking out but they didn't seem bothered.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in London”
Reviews.Author: tfmath
Reviews.Content: The Boston Manor Hotel is a fantastic place to stay for many reasons. The room was a great value for the money and a full, English breakfast was included (eggs, toast, bacon, sausage, beans, juice). The service was excellent, the room was nice and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. It is located about a ten-minute walk from a tube station (Picadilly Line) and it is about a twenty-five-minute ride into central London. I found this very convenient. There are a few shops near the tube station to purchase various food items and there is a restaurant (Harvest Restaurant) within walking distance that has great food selections and daily early-bird specials that run all day. The neighborhood is safe and there is a beautiful park nearby. The Boston Manor Hotel is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: HullSteve_H
Reviews.Content: OK, so it's not the Ritz. That said, for the cost, you'd do well to find better in London. It would benefit from the paintwork being touched up, but overall it was very clean and comfortable. Everything worked - full Satellite or Freeview would be an improvement, although not an essential. Breakfasts filling and the staff were very polite and helpful. Very handily placed for the Tube. Good variety of eateries within 10 minutes walk. (NB don't know what Nicole from Kent was expecting, probably the world for nothing! The day we left there were 3 Merc, a Jag, a Lexus and a 7 Series Beamer in the car park and they wouldn't be there if it was dross!)

Reviews.Title: “pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: marcinpol
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean, my room had a corner bath , Bed was comfortable just what i need after a long drive down. Had a lovely indian meal at he retaurant and breakfast was served well. Freindly staff, close to the tube and the car park made my stay the more comfortable. Superb value for money

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: nicole_mariot
Reviews.Content: as convienient as we were going to the university and being the only hotel available in the area apart from staying in a b&b we decided to stay here but there was supposed to be a restaurant and bar, but it was closed due to refurbishment (good job we had eaten already), we were shown to our triple room (a double bed and one single) which was good that we could stay together but infact the double bed was two singles pushed together and were not even the same hieght and would have been more comfortable lying on a brick. The room was very out dated and in need of refurbishment also the televison facilities very old fashioned. The sheets were clean on the bed but the room was cold and based right next to the kitchen we were woken with lots of noise very early which didn't fare well for my sons university exam. The breakfast service was more self service for cutlery, drinks, but the tea was good! breakfast was cooked but no effort made just basic and not even proper back backon cheap streaky bacon, it was family run and the staff friendly but would not recommend to anyone who has standards (and i don't mean 5 star) and who lives in just a basic family home.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: ALB1985
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents as it is a short drive to my flat. I checked in with them and the reception staff were pleasent. However the hotel itself is vile! The room wasn't clean, there was what looked like jam smeared on the wall, bedding horrible and it smelt damp. I felt awful having booked it for them and wont be doing it again! £55 b&b is definatley a rip off for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Manor was more then Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thesegmrs
Reviews.Content: For the last 20 months i have always booked our hotels trough Travelrepublic....For a reason this time i have booked this hotel direct with the hotel owner on line. Also this was a hotel that i have booked for a couple of me , and also friends of my club Msida Red Stars AFC. From what they told they were so happy and very satified that we have booked this hotel. Boston Manor Hotel is a clean hotel, with good breakfast and very friendly Owners.Tube are only few miniute walk away from hotel.This couple flyed to Luton Airport quit a bit far away. But the very Helpful and friendly owner Mr Raj arrange a taxi to pick my friends from airport to hotel for just £45 each way. What i wish to say is this, ok i accept the fact that many people are born complainers but i wish that people will say the realities a about the hotels they use,both when do have to complain and so when they feels they have to praise a hotel.As people looks in Tripadvisor to search reviews just to find the truths about the hotels. To be honest the bad review we read about hotel was scaring us away from booking this Hotel.But we still took the chance and booked a ensuit dauble room in this hotel for £275 for 5 nights with breakfast 21st/26th.Oct 2010....My friends told me that they recived much more value then for what they paid for. They also praise Mr Raj as a real gentleman,who help them in all ways.They were also happy and surprise that when they get back to hetel to pick their luggage and for the taxi to airport....they found Mr Ray waiting them with an envelope with two rings that they have left behind in a drawer in the bedroom that they had vacanted earlier....A Big thanks to Mr Raj and hotel staff. I will certainily recomand this hotel to my friends. Anthony Arpa on behalf of Karl Pace and Sabrina Farrugia-Malta

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: crackers_hkr
Reviews.Content: On arrival me and a work colleague were shown to a single room (each), which although it wasn't particularly large, it had most things needed for a convenient stay as we would only be sleeping in the room anyway. We were supposed to be in the rooms for 4 nights. However, on the 3rd day (after 2 nights) we received a call saying the room had been double booked and that they had moved both of our bags and belongings into a twin room. This should not of happened!! The staff spoke very little English and the cooked breakfast left a lot to be desired and I found myself sticking to the cereal provided.

Reviews.Title: “Basic- good value for money”
Reviews.Author: rollingstone8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the BM hotel at least 30 nights this year, each time on my own $. I would describe the place as cheep and cheerful and resonably clean with comfortable beds. The staff are helpful, there is secure offstreet parking and an awesome curry joint on the ground floor, and kebak joint over the road, which I rate as one of the best in town. The underground is a 10 min walk down BM road, a 30 min ride downtown. By road access to the M4 and M40 is very easy. This place certainly ain't the Hilton, the Four Seasons nor the Intecontinental, but at £40 per night single and £55 double in West London what the £^c$ do you expect !!??

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money :)”
Reviews.Author: Emmma_Jammmie
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here at the end of november for our years anniversary and it had everything we needed (not so much desired) and had a good location. The Good It was right next to the underground and the easiest thing in the world to find. The staff were courteous and very very friendly (if not a bit shy) and very helpful as well, the hairdryer wasnt included but they dug one out especially for us and gave us directions everywhere (H) The Bad well there wasn't much wrong with it i mean it was a budget holiday, under the beds could be a bit tidier and maybe looked at once in a while :P and my boyfriend expected a bath ( i dont know why) but he was disappointed about that. Overall we loved it we wanted something cheap and thats what we got we only stayed for one night but i would of stayed longer, you think about what you pay for so its not going to be amazing but it was still good value on that account. The included fry up in the morning was awesome :) you could have as much as you wanted and it was lovely and hot... despite any other comments :)

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service? Where?”
Reviews.Author: danielkenyon
Reviews.Content: I never even stayed i was that appauled at the level of customer service that i received from the management team. Upon booking there was no mention of the full amount of the stay being taken from my bank account and put into holding. When i called the hotel direct i was told the money had not been taken. MY BANK SAYS OTHERWISE. I dont advise anyone to stay at this hotel if you look for any customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Sat nav required!”
Reviews.Author: sweeties1975
Reviews.Content: Checked in and the receptionist said that the roo was up two sets of stairs......only thing was that it was down two flights of stairs,round a few twists and turn and then 10 minutes later we got to our room! Massive room,clean and tidy. Local amenities close by.The breakfast was very sloppy though.Left it and just had the toast as it was that bad.

Reviews.Title: “The Boston Manor scores again!!”
Reviews.Author: lancecampeau
Reviews.Content: I wrote an earlier review and mentioned that we were staying again at The Boston Manor again in June,09 and then again in July,09..Once again , it is a quirky hotel, but with the staff they have,we will always be staying here !! After 10 months, they remembered my name and rushed a large, cold "Cobra" beer to my table..Was I impressed,?,,,Damn right!!! This kind of service does NOT happen at a large chain-type establishment but is what you will get at The Boston Manor..I WILL be staying there again with my family as the service more than makes up for any perceived shortcomings..OK, I wish there was a lift but the staff will help you out with your bags, etc.. Many great local pubs (try The Viaduct Pub, 5 min walk) and shops, even a Rolls-Royce dealership in the area (Hanwell)..Yup, we like the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Boston Manor Hotel - Very Basic !!”
Reviews.Author: Bristolmember
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my relatives in April for a sightseeing tour of London. This hotel is only worth staying in for the one night due to the poor room quality and overall cleanliness . The twin room which I stayed in was very basic with poor mismatched furniture and uncomfortable bed. It was not a room in which you could relax in after a long day sightseeing. The bathroom was very small and unclean. The only positive about this experience is the fact that the hotel has a nice indian restraurant, has parking and is near to a tube station. I know the hotel is situation in London and on reflection is quite reasonably priced. However I do not think that cheap should automatically mean that the accommodation should be small, cramped and unclean.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, decent and near Heathrow”
Reviews.Author: gauravm03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as I had some work in the city. I paid £55 for a double bed including breakfast which was good value considering that the room was pretty big and also the b/f was good. The hotel is on piccadilly line (10 min walk to tube station) in zone 4. I found that it was good value as it was near the airport with easy access into town (30mins to central london by tube). It was cheaper compared to other budget options like IBIS, premier inn etc. The staff was very helpful, they helped us carry our luggage to our room. We had lots of heavy luggage as we were returning after a long vacation. Also they stored our luggage when were in town before our evening flight. Many chain hotels in London now refuse to store luggage due to security reasons. We were also given complimentary Internet for our room. The place has a reasonabaly priced Indian restaurant where we had our dinner. The food was average. Its a good option if you are tired and dont want to go out I would recommend this hotel to anyone who does not want to pay £100 a night for a room and wants to be near the airport with good access to the center as well. Also because of the size of the room I would recommend this to budget business travellers who want to stay for a longer period. I would stay here again if I am flying to/from Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “Only a 3 rating because its in London”
Reviews.Author: antonyschn
Reviews.Content: I left it late to book a hotel for my weekend in London so this seriously reduced the choice in the (what I consider) reasonable price range. The best (and nearly only) choice seemed this hotel I picked it mainly because it was the most convenient for the price, close (ish) to the piccadily line & close to a night bus route from central London. In these terms it did everything it needed too- but I have stayed at far more convenient (and better) hotels for less. The public areas of the hotel were dated, tired and in places not overly clean. I too laughed like the previous reviewers at the 'Luxury suite' signs! I cannot imagine what definition of Luxury they have used! The room itself was similar- the delightful net curtains were a lovely shade of yellow & the windows were dirty. I would also bet that this room has recently been smoked in (is this not banned now?). The sheets were worn but were clean & the bed was on the hard side but one of the better hotel beds to sleep in. The bathroom at first appeared clean, but whilst sat on the toilet (sorry!) I noticed nasty looking stains on the door frame (erghh!). The busy road mentioned before didnt affect me (except the drunks at 3.00 am) and I had a decent nights sleep. Breakfast was OK actually- OJ was OK, cooked brekkie not too cheap & nasty- apparently branded cereals. The staff didn't speak much English, and there was a highly embarassing incident on an adjoining table (the customer wanted wholemeal toast- this was incorrect 3 times, ignored twice & then finally it was deduced that they didn't have any!) Didn't make breakfast second day unfortunately but nothing at all to complain about on my part....... Hotel itself is about 10 mins walk to tube one way (with a (shock) decent Harvester on the way if you are hungry. The other way some pubs (polish or Irish- take your pick!) & places to eat. There is also an Indian Restaurant in the hotel itself, but didn't try this out... In the context of London hotels I feel that a 2 rating would be mean for this hotel- I reluctantly give it a 3 because I have stayed at a number of London Hotels in this price range & really it is not bad in comparison. (That said I have given better in Blackpool a 1 rating lol!) Would stay again for the right price, but would look elsewhere first......

Reviews.Title: “job done”
Reviews.Author: SpianBella
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I simply needed somewhere to put our heads down for the night after a concert at wembley stadium. This hotel was cheap, clean and completely adequate. You won't be wowed by the place but it's easy to find from the tube station and for £55 per double room including breakfast (which I didn't sample due to a little over-indulgence the night before) you really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A FIND!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: carslates
Reviews.Content: We forgot to book a hotel for a group of us and our friends for a night out in London so on the Wednesday night I looked on hotel.deals website and this hotel flashed up. £50 for a double room incl. brekkie and £40 for a single. Considering that we just wanted to have a place to rest our heads when we got back, we snapped up 5 rooms. You just have to remember that it's only a 3* hotel but if they judged hotels on staff, friendliness and brekkie, I'd give it a 10/10. The staff were amazing and couldn't do enough to help us. The rooms were vast and immaculate!!! We will definitely be coming back again. I'm sorry but £50 is a bargain!!! Travelodge wanted £85 for the room excl. brekkie!! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. Just don't go wearing rose tinted glasses when you get there. Oh and the added bonus is that they have a car park round the back of the hotel which is CCTV monitored - come on, what more could you ask for!!! Breakfast was gorgeous. As much tea, coffee, fruit juice, cereal you wanted PLUS a full english breakfast - WOW!!!... BOOK THIS HOTEL WITH CONFIDENCE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Jack1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely HORRIBLE! We were shocked when we saw our room so we asked for a roomchange. We got the room as seen on the pictures. Unfortunately we forgot to make pictures of the 1st room which was even worse than the 2nd one. Each corner of the hotel was filthy, on each floor you could smell the currydishes (Owner is from India) It's a shame that this 'hotel' is still open!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God”
Reviews.Author: jamaicabay
Reviews.Content: on arrival we were greeted by a nice receptionist who took us to our room once opened the door well what a suprise 4 single homemade beds with old mattresses and grubby duvet covers and dirty carpet could get over this as the beds had clean sheets but the bathroom was another story black all around the base of the shower a dribble of water from the shower that went from hot to cold you also had to hold the shower because the holder was broken. Didnt dare have Breakfast. This Hotel Boasts 3 stars I really think The English tourist board should review their star ratings

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous - especially for lone females”
Reviews.Author: noileena
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?! I don't tend to write reviews about hotels, but my experience here was so bad, I had to do this. Before I arrived, I phoned the hotel to ask if they had ample parking, given that I wouldn't be arriving until 8pm. I was assured they would, so I went ahead with my booking. On arrival, there was no parking, so I had to park on the road - and this is not a good neighbourhood. I planned to walk to the tube station the next morning, but it is a LONG way, through a less desirable area. Reception was lovely, but as I climbed the stairs, I realised it was like a terrible B&B. The lock to the door of my room was precarious, and as a lone feamle traveller, I was not impressed! There was a disco in my bathroom, with the light flickering and water running. The room was so cold, because the windows didn't fit the frame, and every bit of road noise could be heard - there'd have been no difference if I'd opened the windows! The carpet was so dirty, I didn't dare take my shoes off, but on the plus, the bed did seem clean. However, the lock of th door was the final straw, so I rang around and found a Travelodge for a very similar price close by, and left. Reception offered me another room but it was too little too late - I didn't expect the world, i know £50 doesn't get a lot in London, but this shouldn't have been more than £25, if that! I must say, this is the worst place I have ever stayed, and I have been to some far flung places. I tried to support a local business rather than a chain of hotels, but next time I will be sticking with what i know!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: artchix17
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel convenient to Heathrow because you're booked on an inconveniently scheduled flight (i.e. 8am departure), forget this place. From the Boston Manor tube stop it's a 15-minute slog of a walk with luggage in tow, and then about a 20-minute tube ride to the terminal (we ended up taking a taxi). It is also really expensive to get in and out of central London (as of this writing, GBP 4 each way). The place is run down and depressing (okay, maybe not by British standards) and the rooms on the front are too noisy with truck traffic for sound sleeping. Breakfast is included in the room rate, but when we asked for some breakfast food the night before because we were departing before their 7am start of breakfast service, they refused (even tho they have a fridge they offered for storing anything we cared to purchase). We had two rooms booked for us and two kids: they upgraded us to a room big enough for all 4 (one full and two twin beds) but refused to let us exchange our reserved two cheaper rooms for that one more expensive one (which would have saved us some dough) even tho we ended up not using the kids' room (they wanted to stay in ours because theirs was far away through a lybranthine arrangement of poky corridors and staircases). The room we did use was cramped with all those beds and the bathroom barely big enough to turn around in. The whole experience was pretty creepy and unpleasant. We'd have done better to have sprung for the Holiday Inn Heathrow or similar, with free van service to the terminal and much more comfortable accommodation. A lousy end to a great visit to England.

Reviews.Title: “this is a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TARALondon
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay and would definately stay again. The room, I had was clean and more importanly the bathroom was immaculate. I am a female business traveller and found this place to be very safe and comfortable. Breakfast was very good and considering it was included in the price of the accommodation I found this place to be great value for money. The staff were very friendly in particular , they were very helpful in providing local information and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be going again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked two twin rooms for 4 people and was given two rooms, one with four beds and the other with two!! They refused to remove the other two beds. Good points: Car parking space - big plus point, almost guaranteed, there were always spaces when I needed one. Staff were always friendly Bad points: The place was dirty!! the whole place was in need of painting and general refurbishment. There were torn carpets everywhere and dust in all the nooks and crannies. The rooms was also not clean, dust was gathering and there were stains on the carpet. Under the bed was rubbish left by previous guests which the staff had not spotted. The rooms needed an overhaul!! It was freezing!! The heating was sporadic at best and I needed to sleep with a jumper and socks to stay warm. It was noisy, you are able to hear peoples conversations on the street below if they are talking even slightly above normal levels and you are definitely able to hear traffic clearly. Bathroom: Tiny!!! The basin was tiny and it was almost impossible to wash your hands in it. The toilet was placed (presumably to save space) in such a way that your knees were touching the walls in front when you sat on it!! The shower was an electric one that barely ran to a trickle!! Also, it was impossible to control (believe me I tried for almost 20minutes) the temperature. The water was either boiling hot or freezing cold and nothing inbetween. Breakfast: Consists of cereal (help yourself), toast and full english breakfast (one sausage - still raw in the middle, one slice of bacon - although I did not get one unlike the three other members of my group, 2 eggs and 1/8 of a tomato) and tea or coffee. In terms of location, it is 10-15minutes walk to Boston Manor tube station which is 45 minutes approx to Leicester Square. There is an Esso station opposite which is helpful for filling petrol on your return journey.

Reviews.Title: “Awful rooms, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boston Manor on the 27th November and was very disappointed. Booked 4 double rooms for our group, who were going to our works xmas party. 1 room was a single room (box room), 2 were family rooms (fine size) and 1 was a small twin room. The small twin was occupied by a couple with a pregnant wife, and due to the position of the basin in the bathroom, she could not get in the shower. My room had a bathroom with mastick hanging off the shower cubicle, a massive rubble 'crack' around the ceiling of the bathroom, a stained bedside lamp (looked like it had been dropped down the toilet) and terrible decor. The photos on all the websites you see are a shocking misrepresentation of the hotel. The downstairs is a building site and the upstairs is dated - needing a good few licks of paint and some signs to direct you to the rooms. My room was fairly quiet (although I sleep heavily) but the other couples complained about noise and banging early in the morning. The service at breakfast was terrible, with me and my partner sat like lemons being ignored by the staff serving others, until the manager arrived and started sorting everyone out. Breakfast was 2 eggs, a sausage, a slice of bacon, and a quarter of an ungrilled tomato, and it was cold. Would not recommend to anyone and would not stay again at any cost. Stay at the Travel Lodge down the road for an extra £10 - £15. At least you know what you're getting!!

HotelInfo.Name: Boston Manor Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 146-152 Boston Road | Hanwell, Ealing, London W7 2HJ, England
